intro: Orophaca, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Orophaca typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is often hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
